publicationStmt.p: published electronically as part of the TLS project at https://hxwd.org

sourceDesc.p: Created by members of the TLS project

tls:text.tls:line: How could legal restrictions and punishments in themselves ever
How could legal restrictions and punishments in themselves ever

sense.def: various kinds of penalties and punishments

tls:text.tls:line: did not set up laws and measures
did not set up laws and measures
[Their] laws and rules were not the same.
[Their] laws and rules were not the same.
[Their] laws and rules were not the same.
Laws and orders were clear and there was no confusion.
with their deviousness they contravene
his laws and edicts being circumspect will not be unduly harsh,
but we guard their laws and registers, ordinances and orders.

sense.def: the laws and measures/regulations of the contextually determinate N

tls:text.tls:line: he will voluntarily abide by laws and regulations

seg.line: 則先王之法度有移易者矣。

tls:text.tls:srcline: 則先王之法度有移易者矣。

sense.def: written decision by the relevant authorities

tls:text.tls:line: the laws and regulations
the laws and regulations
the laws and regulations

seg.line: 非得聖王為之法度而教導之，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 非得聖王為之法度而教導之，

sense.def: the laws and measures/regulations of the contextually determinate N

tls:text.tls:line: It wasn't that there were no laws and regulations/administrative procedures
The laws are published with an eye

sense.def: the physical object constituted by a legal text

tls:text.tls:line: The laws are published with an eye

sense.def: cause to hang> suspend, hang; tie up and hang up

tls:text.tls:line: to punishing those who violate them;
to punishing those who violate them;
and in the lands beyond the seas men became crafty.
The lands beyond the seas acknowledged his suzerainty

sense.def: be consistent with, not be incompatible with
dredge out and explain; give full expression to.
be weak and easily broken 說文：易斷

seg.line: 相與優游競暢于宇宙之間，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 相與優游競暢于宇宙之間，
tls:text.tls:line: mutually roaming freely and racing to fill the interstices of time and space,

sense.def: the universe of space and time (according to HNZ "the (cosmic) eaves and rafters" 高誘 注："宇，屋簷也；宙，棟梁也。")

tls:text.tls:line: Reach for it, and you cannot grasp it.

sense.def: grasp after, hold on to, touch, reach out after

tls:text.tls:line: Heaven and Earth had not yet split apart;
yin and yang had not yet been carved out;
[You can] hide a boat in a ravine,

sense.def: hide/store N1 in the place N2
hide/store N1 in the place N2

tls:text.tls:line: in the middle of the night, a strong man can put [the boat] on his back and run off with it,

sense.def: race away from the place N

tls:text.tls:line: and the sleeper does not know about it.
he did not know that he had ever been a human being.

sense.def: at one point, some time ago; once in the past, on one occasion; in the past;

tls:text.tls:line: When ice welcomes spring, it melts and becomes water.
The myriad things were peaceful and dispassionate and so became contented and tranquil.

sense.def: human subject: be quiet; be in a state of quiet tranquility; have inner peace

tls:text.tls:line: The myriad things were peaceful and dispassionate and so became contented and tranquil.
The myriad things were peaceful and dispassionate and so became contented and tranquil.
The myriad things were peaceful and dispassionate and so became contented and tranquil.

sense.def: be serene, have peace of mind, be calm 甚靜

tls:text.tls:line: drummed on their bellies in contentment.
drummed on their bellies in contentment.

sense.def: fool around, play around; mess about with

tls:text.tls:line: only then do we understand the vigor of pine and cypress;
only then do we understand the vigor of pine and cypress;
Thus, they take the Way as their pole;

sense.def: bamboo pole; pole; staff[aslo rod for fishing][CA]

tls:text.tls:line: Humaneness and Rightness as their bait;
They view benefit and harm as dust and dirt,

sense.def: dust and dirt (often: of this world); mere dust 塵垢之外

tls:text.tls:line: view life and death as day and night.
these are unable to disturb their harmony.
is like an encounter with mosquitoes and gnats
is like an encounter with mosquitoes and gnats
A fast wind can snap trees,
A fast wind can snap trees,
a person who falls will break his spine and shatter his skull,

sense.def: fall; fall off (a horse); fall out (of teeth)

tls:text.tls:line: a person who falls will break his spine and shatter his skull,
a person who falls will break his spine and shatter his skull,
a person who falls will break his spine and shatter his skull,
a person who falls will break his spine and shatter his skull,
Now to accumulate wisdom and multiply generosity,

sense.def: collect and amass, typically on a large scale

tls:text.tls:line: Now to accumulate wisdom and multiply generosity,

sense.def: an ability to engage in profound and thorough reflection; discursive cleverness; BUDDH: the highest form of religious consciousness and insight, and one of the perfections of the Boddhisattva. Sanskrit prajñā.

tls:text.tls:line: Now to accumulate wisdom and multiply generosity,
Now to accumulate wisdom and multiply generosity,
To block off the nine orifices,

sense.def: block up, cause to be closed to the outside; block out (outsiders)

tls:text.tls:line: To block off the nine orifices,

sense.def: opening to the outside world, aperture; hollow; hole
store up; take good care of; store up and collect; store up to keep safe

tls:text.tls:line: [with] dragons, snakes, tigers, and lepards,

sense.def: dragon[BUDDH: in the Buddhist context dragons (SANSKRIT nāga) are regarded as one of the eight kind of beings who protect the Buddhist teachings]

tls:text.tls:line: [with] dragons, snakes, tigers, and lepards,
[with] dragons, snakes, tigers, and lepards,
[with] dragons, snakes, tigers, and lepards,
you will not be able to avoid becoming enslaved to material things.

sense.def: serve as a dependent or slave

tls:text.tls:line: you will not be able to avoid becoming enslaved to material things.
you will not be able to avoid becoming enslaved to material things.
Your mistakes are already made:
For this reason, sages inwardly cultivate the techniques of the way
For this reason, sages inwardly cultivate the techniques of the way

sense.def: the person of extraordinary and creative talent (with untensed predicate)

tls:text.tls:line: For this reason, sages inwardly cultivate the techniques of the way
For this reason, sages inwardly cultivate the techniques of the way

sense.def: cultivate (one's person, the ancients etc); apply oneself to; train and exercise (troops); occasionally also with negative objects: LH 2 修詐 "cultivate fraudulence"

tls:text.tls:line: and do not adorn themselves externally with Humaneness and Rightness.

sense.def: externally; on the outside; as a visible expression; towards the outside

tls:text.tls:line: and do not adorn themselves externally with Humaneness and Rightness.

sense.def: put on an attractive show of

tls:text.tls:line: below survey the three springs,
below survey the three springs,

sense.def: look for (a thing); seek to obtain

tls:text.tls:line: broadly span the six coordinates,
bind and unite the myriad things,

sense.def: the myriad kinds of things/creatures; all manner of things

tls:text.tls:line: flow into utmost emptiness

sense.def: ultimately; extremely; to the highest degree; be the most (marker of superlative)

tls:text.tls:line: they ride the gryphon and follow the sphinx;
take Mi Fei as a concubine,
They subjugate the Duke of Thunder,

sense.def: gain as a minister; make into a minister; take as a servant

tls:text.tls:line: it will certainly obscure their vision.
How much more is this true of what cannot envelope these very things?

seg.line: 此其為山淵之勢亦遠矣。

tls:text.tls:srcline: 此其為山淵之勢亦遠矣。
tls:text.tls:line: This is even further from the grandeur of mountains and abysses.

sense.def: "the general point is": particle marking a generalising judgment

tls:text.tls:line: and the myriad things were greatly abundant.

sense.def: be in abundant supply; have a surplus, not be exhausted (often used figuratively)

tls:text.tls:line: When the age declined,
Coming to the age of the Divine Farmer
and the Yellow Emperor

sense.def: Unger no. 235, also UNGER SACH Huang ti

tls:text.tls:line: kneaded the hard and the soft,

sense.def: that which is firm, the firm and strong things; a hard substance

tls:text.tls:line: kneaded the hard and the soft,
kneaded the hard and the soft,
Coming down to the house of Zhou,

sense.def: yì jí: when it came to the time of

tls:text.tls:line: the collected wealth [of the world] was insufficient to meet their expenses.

seg.line: 以求鑿枘於世而錯擇名利，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 以求鑿枘於世而錯擇名利，
tls:text.tls:line: seeking to force conditions on the age and crookedly acquire fame and profit.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 以求鑿枘於世而錯擇名利，
tls:text.tls:line: seeking to force conditions on the age and crookedly acquire fame and profit.

sense.def: BUDDH: fame and benefit > nominal success in this world, superficial benefit

tls:text.tls:line: and lost the root of the Great Ancestor.

sense.def: come to lose what one used to own (e.g. a city, an arm); lose control of; fail to get right what one ought to get right (timing); MENG: fail to stick to (the Way), stray from, disregard; lose count of (the date); stray from (the right road); lose contact with (a person)

seg.line: 是故舉世而譽之不加勸，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 是故舉世而譽之不加勸，

sense.def: the whole world; everyone in the whole world

tls:text.tls:line: The nature of humans is tranquil, yet desires disorder it.

sense.def: (also written without the 口字旁）all kinds of （excessive） desires

tls:text.tls:line: for mouth and nose [to perceive] fragrances and tastes,
for mouth and nose [to perceive] fragrances and tastes,
for mouth and nose [to perceive] fragrances and tastes,
for mouth and nose [to perceive] fragrances and tastes,
for mouth and nose [to perceive] fragrances and tastes,
for ears and eyes [to perceive] colors and sounds,
for ears and eyes [to perceive] colors and sounds,
for ears and eyes [to perceive] colors and sounds,

sense.def: noise of any kind, sound of any kind

tls:text.tls:line: for ears and eyes [to perceive] colors and sounds,
for flesh and skin [to perceive] cold and heat.
for flesh and skin [to perceive] cold and heat.
If the spirrit is clear, lusts and desires cannot disorder it.

sense.def: (also written without the 口字旁）all kinds of （excessive） desires

tls:text.tls:line: this is to discard your brilliance

sense.def: put down, put aside, put away; reject and rid oneself of; dismiss and reject; sometimes figurative: give up (on a task)

seg.line: 入於四海九江而不能濡，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 入於四海九江而不能濡，
tls:text.tls:line: enter the Four Seas or the Nine Rivers and cannot be trapped;
your words add luster to jade and stone;
you will not even be able to safeguard your person.
If a wasp or a scorpion stings your finger, your spirit cannot remain placid.
If a wasp or a scorpion stings your finger, your spirit cannot remain placid.
If a wasp or a scorpion stings your finger, your spirit cannot remain placid.
If a wasp or a scorpion stings your finger, your spirit cannot remain placid.
to disturb your mind

sense.def: interfere with, disturb the peace of

tls:text.tls:line: How can it be done?

sense.def: cope with, deal with; be able to do something about

tls:text.tls:line: Merchants prospered in their markets;
Merchants prospered in their markets;
Merchants prospered in their markets;
farmers rejoiced in their work;
farmers rejoiced in their work;

sense.def: feel deeply communictively happy with or in

tls:text.tls:line: grasses and trees did not die prematurely;
opened the heart of a worthy man,

sense.def: split; cut open (a heart etc); have cut open (one's back)

tls:text.tls:line: cut off the feet of a talented knight,
minced the daughter of the marquis of Gui,

sense.def: be because of the npro, be the 'fault' of the npro
be because of the npro, be the 'fault' of the npro

tls:text.tls:line: If you put an ape in a cage,

sense.def: place (something N1) in (a place N2), put in a certain place

tls:text.tls:line: If you put an ape in a cage,

sense.def: pen; shed for wild beasts or for domestic animals; fenced enclosure

tls:text.tls:line: it will be just like a pig.
It is not that it is no longer clever or agile

sense.def: be possessed of high skill; be astute; be nimble, dexterous, adroit; artful

tls:text.tls:line: It is not that it is no longer clever or agile

sense.def: be nimble of body, agile, adroit, dextrous
act in accordance with; be in accordance with; obey (the law)

tls:text.tls:line: Heaven dried up and Earth cracked open;

sense.def: be stricken by drought; be characterised by drought 歲旱

tls:text.tls:line: Heaven dried up and Earth cracked open;
Ritual and Rightness, purity and modesty, had not yet been established;
is able to save people from strife;

sense.def: save the contextually determinate people from doing something

tls:text.tls:line: He is tranquilly devoid of desires and the people naturally become simple.

sense.def: be pristine and simple, unadorned, inelaborate; be simple and straight

tls:text.tls:line: but none knows who it is who has done this.
When [the ruler] relieves hardships

sense.def: succour, come to the aid of; save from (e.g. punishment); occasionally: aid and abet

tls:text.tls:line: When [the ruler] relieves hardships
and supplements insufficiencies,

sense.def: improve through repairs (especially clothes); repair by filling in; supplement

tls:text.tls:line: [When he] upholds the beneficial and eliminates the harmful,

sense.def: cause to develop postitively, promote; cause to flourish; bring to fruition

tls:text.tls:line: [When he] upholds the beneficial and eliminates the harmful,

sense.def: assets; what is profitable, what profits; what is in one's interest, benefit; objective interest; what one can aim for as profit

tls:text.tls:line: [When he] upholds the beneficial and eliminates the harmful,

sense.def: abolish; get rid of, weed out; remove; make clean, clear (a road); dismiss from office; have (someone) removed

tls:text.tls:line: [When he] upholds the beneficial and eliminates the harmful,

sense.def: something that does damage (human or animal); menace

tls:text.tls:line: [when he] chastises the disorderly and prohibits cruelty,

sense.def: OBI: lauch an overt large-scale destructive military campaign against what is construed as an enemy of inferior political status

tls:text.tls:line: [when he] chastises the disorderly and prohibits cruelty,

sense.def: what is unruly; what is conducive to political chaos

tls:text.tls:line: [when he] chastises the disorderly and prohibits cruelty,

sense.def: prohibit, forbid, cause to stop, put a stop to prevent, ban; preclude, prevent; constrain

tls:text.tls:line: [when he] chastises the disorderly and prohibits cruelty,
When an age is without calamity or harm,
even a spirit would find no occasion to display his Potency.

sense.def: the spirits; the divine creatures; divinity, spirit (typically belonging to or stemming from Heaven)

tls:text.tls:line: They [trustingly] craddled their infants and children in birds' nests,
and tread upon cobras and pythons [and come to no harm].

sense.def: GUOYU: (specifically) small and often poisonous snake; viper; generally: snake

tls:text.tls:line: and tread upon cobras and pythons [and come to no harm].
the ten suns [once] came out together.

sense.def: shoulder to shoulder, together, side by side; momentaneously; at the same time; 十日並出

tls:text.tls:line: They scorched the standing grain

sense.def: burn so as to make parched dry

tls:text.tls:line: They scorched the standing grain
and the nine provinces became dry again.
and ripped open a pregnant women [to expose her fetus].
and ripped open a pregnant women [to expose her fetus].
and ripped open a pregnant women [to expose her fetus].

sense.def: e.g. 在塗稱婦 "any female of marriagable age"; but also 宮婦,室婦

tls:text.tls:line: He cut open [and extracted the heart of a minister] who remonstrated
[In these ways, Jie and Djou] plundered the world

sense.def: steal from; steal from a place other than the owner's home

tls:text.tls:line: [In these ways, Jie and Djou] plundered the world

sense.def: broadly geographic including populations: All under Heaven

tls:text.tls:line: and ill treated the people.
and ill treated the people.

seg.line: 於是湯乃以革車三百乘伐桀于南巢，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 於是湯乃以革車三百乘伐桀于南巢，
tls:text.tls:line: Accordingly, then, Tang employed three hundred war chariots to attack Jie south of Chao

sense.def: military technical term: heavy leather-covered battle wagon

tls:text.tls:line: it is necessary to encounter the calamities of a disorderly age.
it is necessary to encounter the calamities of a disorderly age.
it is necessary to encounter the calamities of a disorderly age.

sense.def: disorderly, unruly; chaotic; doomed to chaos; bent on chaos

tls:text.tls:line: it is necessary to encounter the calamities of a disorderly age.

sense.def: disaster, misfortune; resulting trouble (from one's actions) 三患"three kinds of disaster"

tls:text.tls:line: who internalizes Potency, embracres the Way,

sense.def: hold in one's mouth> encompass; have within one, contain

tls:text.tls:line: who internalizes Potency, embracres the Way,
Consequently, there are many [such] who die without ever having spoken,

sense.def: eventually; and so in the end, and in the event; and then, thereupon, subsequently; eventually, in the event

tls:text.tls:line: Consequently, there are many [such] who die without ever having spoken,

sense.def: be many, be numerous; contain many members; be in the majority 甚眾

tls:text.tls:line: is not the enduring Way;
are not enduring names.
one does not dare to cross the [Yellow] River without a boat."
"One does not dare to attack a tiger bare-handed;

sense.def: deal violently with, show violence towards

tls:text.tls:line: The Hundred Traditions have different theories,

sense.def: (all) the (respectable) philosophers (of different persuasians) See Jens Østergaard Petersen 1995: "What Books Did the First Emperor of China Burn"
(all) the (respectable) philosophers (of different persuasians) See Jens Østergaard Petersen 1995: "What Books Did the First Emperor of China Burn"
明帝王之政“the bovernment by the enlightened kings": N1=agent or subject of the Nab-ing (perhaps 之 = 之所？）
明帝王之政“the bovernment by the enlightened kings": N1=agent or subject of the Nab-ing (perhaps 之 = 之所？）

tls:text.tls:line: are the sun, moon, stars, planets, thunder lightning, wind, and rain.
are the sun, moon, stars, planets, thunder lightning, wind, and rain.
are the sun, moon, stars, planets, thunder lightning, wind, and rain.
are the sun, moon, stars, planets, thunder lightning, wind, and rain.
are the sun, moon, stars, planets, thunder lightning, wind, and rain.
are the sun, moon, stars, planets, thunder lightning, wind, and rain.
When the vital essence flows to the eye, vision is clear;
When the vital essence flows to the eye, vision is clear;
When the vital essence flows to the eye, vision is clear;
the hundred joints have no diseases.
The sources of profligate indolence are fivefold:
building palaces and halls;
building palaces and halls;

sense.def: palace 宮婦 宮中七市"three markets in the palace compound"

tls:text.tls:line: building palaces and halls;
water chestnut and dwarf oak twining and enfolding;
water chestnut and dwarf oak twining and enfolding;
Such is profligate indolence based on wood.
Great bells and tripods,
Great bells and tripods,

sense.def: bell (loan for zhǒng 鐘) [We need to create a new lexeme character with the correct pronunciation. CH]

tls:text.tls:line: Great bells and tripods,
now dark, now bright,

sense.def: abruptly; suddenly out of the blue; unexpectedly; inadvertently; once...then

tls:text.tls:line: tree trunks are baked to make charcoal;
grass is burned to make ash,
The earthen [walls] were not patterned;
things that are extraordinary, different, and surprising
things that are extraordinary, different, and surprising
are enough to cause alterations and changes in te heart and will,
are enough to cause alterations and changes in the heart and will,
to agitate and unsettle one's essence and spirit,
to agitate and unsettle one's essence and spirit,
to agitate and unsettle one's essence and spirit,

sense.def: subtle spirit; subtle spirits [occasionally: essential sprits; vital forces][CA]; soul as seat of thought

tls:text.tls:line: The sage adheres to the five modes of conduct,

sense.def: the person of extraordinary and creative talent (with untensed predicate)

tls:text.tls:line: The sage adheres to the five modes of conduct,

sense.def: temper, moderate; be moderate with respect to

tls:text.tls:line: In ancient times when the sage-kings occupied the throne,
In ancient times when the sage-kings occupied the throne,
older brothers were nurturing and younger brothers compliant;
older brothers were nurturing and younger brothers compliant;
older brothers were nurturing and younger brothers compliant;

sense.def: obey the wishes and orders of the contextually determinate N

tls:text.tls:line: and the people obtained what they desired.
hunting and fishing were heavily taxed;

sense.def: official hunt (as of an official party, e.g. the emperor); occasionally used in neutralised general sense: "hunt"; hunting

tls:text.tls:line: hunting and fishing were heavily taxed;
hunting and fishing were heavily taxed;
The people's strength was exhausted by corvée labor;
travelers had no provisions;

sense.def: victuals; grain, provisions; food rations for travel; rations

tls:text.tls:line: the dead were not buried.
but even so they were unable to satisfy them.

sense.def: still; nonetheless; in spite of everything (said in S and not said in S)

tls:text.tls:line: but even so they were unable to satisfy them.

sense.def: satisfy the contextually determinate N, ensure sufficiant supplies for the contextually determinate N

seg.line: 愚夫惷婦皆有流連之心，

tls:text.tls:srcline: 愚夫惷婦皆有流連之心，
tls:text.tls:line: Clueless common men and simple women all were left with their hearts in turmoil and flux

sense.def: intellectually stupid and morally insensitive (of persons and opinions etc)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 愚夫惷婦皆有流連之心，
tls:text.tls:line: Clueless common men and simple women all were left with their hearts in turmoil and flux

sense.def: adult male (of an age where he tends to be married)

tls:text.tls:srcline: 愚夫惷婦皆有流連之心，
tls:text.tls:line: Clueless common men and simple women all were left with their hearts in turmoil and flux

tls:text.tls:srcline: 愚夫惷婦皆有流連之心，
tls:text.tls:line: Clueless common men and simple women all were left with their hearts in turmoil and flux

sense.def: e.g. 在塗稱婦 "any female of marriagable age"; but also 宮婦,室婦

tls:text.tls:srcline: 愚夫惷婦皆有流連之心，
tls:text.tls:line: Clueless common men and simple women all were left with their hearts in turmoil and flux
In ancient times, the demands of those on high were light, and the people's needs were met.
In ancient times, the demands of those on high were light, and the people's needs were met.
In ancient times, the demands of those on high were light, and the people's needs were met.
In ancient times, the demands of those on high were light, and the people's needs were met.
ministers amply fulfilled [their duty of] loyalty.

sense.def: realise completely, realise exhaustively; carry through successfully and completely

tls:text.tls:line: Fathers behaved compassionately;
Fathers behaved compassionately;

sense.def: work towards; be concerned with in one's actions, show concern for, concentrate on

tls:text.tls:line: Fathers behaved compassionately;
Anger and rancor filled every breast;
Anger and rancor filled every breast;
Anger and rancor filled every breast;

sense.def: to give content (to something); to accomplish; to make abundant; make one's presence felt throughout

tls:text.tls:line: Anger and rancor filled every breast;

sense.def: chest; the seat of thoughts, virtues, and emotions

tls:text.tls:line: thoughtful minds were entirely extinct.
thoughtful minds were entirely extinct.
In ancient times, the Son of Heaven had his royal domain,
In ancient times, the Son of Heaven had his royal domain,

sense.def: a king; an emperor; the king or emperor generally (with untensed predicate)

tls:text.tls:line: each took care of his own portion,

sense.def: each of the subjects (each in their own manner); each and everyone

tls:text.tls:line: each took care of his own portion,

sense.def: be in charge of, keep order in

tls:text.tls:line: who was cruel and oppressive to the masses,

sense.def: be violent so as to tyrannise

tls:text.tls:line: who was cruel and oppressive to the masses,
who fought over land and tried to usurp territory,

sense.def: quarrel about (a contentious issue) sometimes written 諍

tls:text.tls:line: who fought over land and tried to usurp territory,

sense.def: land; piece of land; territory; area; (possibly small) open space

tls:text.tls:line: who fought over land and tried to usurp territory,

sense.def: invade, make an incursion into; invasion, incursion; sometimes generally: attack (place or persons, eg 侵我 "attacked us"

tls:text.tls:line: who fought over land and tried to usurp territory,
who when summoned [to the king's court] would not come,

sense.def: summon officially; summon in; call in; deliver a summons (on behalf of a ruler), call in (on behalf of someone else); occasionally with abstract objects 召恥

tls:text.tls:line: who when summoned [to the king's court] would not come,

sense.def: arrive on the scene; turn up; move in to take action; come to join

tls:text.tls:line: who when given commands would not carry them out,

sense.def: issue effective orders to: to command, to order; to order officially; issue an order to (ministers etc)

tls:text.tls:line: who when given commands would not carry them out,

sense.def: do the contextually determinate thing N; act according to; carry out, practise (a contextually defined thing);

tls:text.tls:line: who when forbidden [things] would not desist,

sense.def: prohibit, forbid, cause to stop, put a stop to prevent, ban; preclude, prevent; constrain

tls:text.tls:line: who when forbidden [things] would not desist,

sense.def: desist, not go or get through with a planned action; stop one's habitual action

tls:text.tls:line: who when admonished would not alter,
who when admonished would not alter,

sense.def: change one's original ways; change from one's original state; change one's standard course (as the heavenly bodies)

tls:text.tls:line: small countries built fortifications to defend themselves.

sense.def: build city walls; build a city wall

tls:text.tls:line: small countries built fortifications to defend themselves.

sense.def: undertake defensive tasks; be in charge of the defence of the state

tls:text.tls:line: [Such rulers] confiscated people's oxen and horses,

sense.def: water buffalo; ox Keightley: @Foot{I translate oracle-bone @i{niu} 牛 as "bovine"; theinscriptions do not generally indicate whether the bovinesinvolved were female or male.}

tls:text.tls:line: [Such rulers] confiscated people's oxen and horses,

sense.def: horse (said to resemble a deer, which goes to show that the horse was more like a pony)

tls:text.tls:line: destroyed their ancestral temples,

sense.def: destroy, ruin; smash; deliberately ruin (e.g. new trousers so they look old); sometimes metaphorical: maltreat (oneself)

tls:text.tls:line: destroyed their ancestral temples,

sense.def: ancestral temples, temples for the ancestors (symbols of the nation, see this word under NATION)

tls:text.tls:line: carried off their weighty treasures,

sense.def: heavy, substantial; of considerable monetary value

tls:text.tls:line: carried off their weighty treasures,

sense.def: precious possession; precious things; treasure of high personal, monetary, social or moral value 三寶

tls:text.tls:line: and sun-bleached skeletons choked the wild lands.
and sun-bleached skeletons choked the wild lands.

sense.def: human bones in the living body or as part of a skeleton

tls:text.tls:line: and sun-bleached skeletons choked the wild lands.

sense.def: fill out; fill out everywhere 滿於

tls:text.tls:line: and sun-bleached skeletons choked the wild lands.
and sleep without dreams.
and sleep without dreams.
They sit without disturbing thoughts,
They sit without disturbing thoughts,
are not happy are not angry.
are not happy are not angry.
are not sorrowful or joyful;

sense.def: be (or sound) mournful or grief-stricken; show genuine feelings of grief 哭之哀 "lamented for him and show real grief" is idiomatic, and it is tempting to think of this āi 哀 as adverbial, although there is nothing to prove the point

tls:text.tls:line: are not sorrowful or joyful;

sense.def: (of persons) feel deeply moved in the direction of harmonious delight, be full of joy; be joyfully satisfied

tls:text.tls:line: is the heart of the state.
his words are identical with his plans;
Above and below are of one mind.
